## Comprehensive Portfolio Codebase Architecture Report

### 1. PROJECT OVERVIEW

**Type**: React 19 + TypeScript + Vite Single Page Application (SPA)
**Purpose**: Personal portfolio for Dmitrii Fotesco, Senior Technical PM
**Architecture**: Content-driven portfolio with YAML/MDX content management
**URL**: fotesco.dev
**Tech Stack**:
- React 19.2.0 with React DOM
- TypeScript with strict mode
- Vite 7.2.4 (build tool)
- Zod 4.1.13 (validation)
- Framer Motion 12.23.26 (animations)
- React Helmet Async (SEO)
- Gray Matter & YAML (content parsing)
- Vitest 3.2.4 (testing)

### 4. KEY ARCHITECTURAL PATTERNS

#### A. Content Schema Validation Flow

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/lib/schemas.ts
- Defines Zod schemas for 9 content types
- Shared between runtime validation and CLI validation
- Ensures type safety from content to component

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/lib/content.ts
- Imports YAML via Vite plugin: `import profileYaml from '../../content/profile.yaml'`
- Auto-discovers markdown files: `import.meta.glob('../../content/case-studies/*.md')`
- Validates at import time with `validate()` function
- Exports typed, validated content objects

**CLI Tool**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/scripts/validate-content.ts
- Command: `npm run validate`
- Validates all YAML and markdown files before commit
- Exit code 1 if validation fails (blocks CI/CD)

#### B. Markdown Frontmatter Processing

**Pattern**: YAML Frontmatter + Markdown Body

Example from case study:
```yaml
---
id: 1
slug: institutional-eth-staking
title: Institutional ETH Staking
company: Anchorage Digital
year: 2024â€“25
tags: [Staking, Custody, ETF-Grade]
hook:
  headline: Built ETF-grade staking infrastructure
  impactMetric:
    value: "Zero"
    label: slashing events
---
## The Challenge
[Markdown content here...]
```

**Processing**:
1. `parseFrontmatter()` extracts YAML and content via regex
2. YAML.parse() converts frontmatter to object
3. Combine: `{ ...frontmatter, content: markdownBody }`
4. Validate with Zod schema
5. Pass to components

#### C. Theme System Architecture

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/context/ThemeContext.tsx

```typescript
// State management
const [theme, setTheme] = useState<'dark' | 'light'>(
  // Priority: localStorage > system preference > 'dark'
)

// Side effects
useEffect(() => {
  document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', theme)
  localStorage.setItem('portfolio-theme', theme)
})
```

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/styles/globals.css

```css
:root {
  --color-background: #08080a;  /* Dark mode default */
  --color-accent: #c29a6c;
}

[data-theme="light"] {
  --color-background: #fafafa;  /* Light mode override */
  --color-accent: #8a6642;
}
```

**Component Usage**:
```tsx
<div style={{ 
  background: 'var(--color-background)',
  color: 'var(--color-text-primary)' 
}} />
```

**Migration Note**: Previously used `useTheme().colors` (deprecated). Now uses CSS variables exclusively.

#### D. Component Communication Patterns

**State Lifting**: Portfolio.tsx manages global state
```tsx
const [modalCase, setModalCase] = useState<CaseStudy | null>(null)
const [hoveredCase, setHoveredCase] = useState<number | null>(null)
```

**Prop Drilling**: Pass callbacks and state to child sections
```tsx
<CaseStudiesSection
  hoveredCase={hoveredCase}
  setHoveredCase={setHoveredCase}
  onCaseClick={(study) => setModalCase(study)}
/>
```

**Modal Pattern**: Conditional rendering with backdrop
```tsx
{modalCase && (
  <CaseStudyDrawer
    isOpen={!!modalCase}
    onClose={() => setModalCase(null)}
    caseStudy={modalCase}
  />
)}
```

---

### 5. CONTENT SCHEMAS & TYPES

**Core Content Types** (defined in /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/types/portfolio.ts):

1. **Profile** - Hero, about, section visibility flags
2. **Experience** - Job history with highlights
3. **Testimonials** - Client/colleague reviews
4. **Certifications** - Professional credentials + onchain identity
5. **Skills** - Categorized skill lists
6. **Social** - Social links + contact CTA
7. **CaseStudy** - Project case studies with metrics
8. **PassionProject** - Side projects
9. **BlogPost** - Blog posts with tags

**Key Schema Features**:
- Optional fields with `.optional()` or `.nullable()`
- Enum validation: `z.enum(['contact', 'calendly', 'linkedin'])`
- Date format validation: `z.string().regex(/^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}$/)`
- Nested objects with structured data
- Array validation with type constraints

**Aggregated Content Interface**:
```typescript
interface PortfolioContent {
  profile: Profile;
  experience: Experience;
  testimonials: Testimonials;
  certifications: Certifications;
  skills: Skills;
  social: Social;
  caseStudies: CaseStudy[];
  passionProjects: PassionProject[];
}
```

---

### 6. COMPONENT ARCHITECTURE

#### Section Components (8 files in src/components/sections/)

**Pattern**: All receive `isMobile`, `isTablet`, `sectionPadding` props

1. **HeroSection.tsx** - Large serif headline with status indicator
2. **AboutSection.tsx** - Bio + stats grid
3. **ExperienceSection.tsx** - Timeline of jobs
4. **CertificationsSection.tsx** - Credential cards + ENS identity
5. **CaseStudiesSection.tsx** - Case study grid with hover states
6. **PassionProjectsSection.tsx** - Side project cards
7. **TestimonialsSection.tsx** - Client testimonials
8. **FooterSection.tsx** - Footer with social links

#### Case Study Drawer Components (7 files in src/components/case-study/)

**Architecture**: Modular drawer split into sub-components

1. **CaseStudyDrawer.tsx** - Main container with slide-in animation
2. **CaseStudyHeader.tsx** - Close button + navigation
3. **CaseStudyHero.tsx** - Thumbnail + title
4. **CaseStudyMetrics.tsx** - Impact metrics display
5. **CaseStudyLinks.tsx** - External links (demo, GitHub, docs, media)
6. **CaseStudyContent.tsx** - Markdown rendering
7. **CaseStudyFooter.tsx** - CTA + navigation arrows

**State Management**: Framer Motion animations with `<AnimatePresence>`

#### Common Components (3 files in src/components/common/)

1. **AmbientBackground.tsx** - Animated orbs + grid overlay
2. **Omnibar.tsx** - Floating action bar (email, resume, book time)
3. **SEO.tsx** - Dynamic meta tags via react-helmet-async

#### Blog Components

1. **Blog.tsx** - Blog list with auto-discovery of markdown files
2. **BlogPostModal.tsx** - Full-screen reader with:
   - Reading progress bar
   - Table of contents with scroll spy
   - Code syntax highlighting
   - Copy code buttons
   - Like system
   - Social sharing
   - Related posts

- Transitions: `cubic-bezier(0.16, 1, 0.3, 1)`

- Ambient orbs: Radial gradients with animation
- Grid overlay: Dot pattern with opacity

```typescript
const isMobile = windowWidth < 768
const isTablet = windowWidth >= 768 && windowWidth < 1024

### 9. BUILD & DEPLOYMENT

**Build Process**:
1. TypeScript compilation: `tsc -b`
2. Vite build: `vite build`
3. Output: `/dist` directory
4. Validation: `npm run validate` (pre-commit)

**Vite Configuration** (/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/vite.config.ts):
```typescript
export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [
    react(),  // React Fast Refresh
    yaml()    // @rollup/plugin-yaml for YAML imports
  ],
  base: '/',
})
```

**Testing**:
- Vitest for unit tests
- @testing-library/react for component tests
- jsdom for DOM simulation
- 7 test files with 187+ passing tests

---

### 10. DEVELOPMENT WORKFLOW

#### Content Updates
1. Edit YAML/markdown in `/content`
2. Run `npm run validate` to check schemas
3. Vite hot-reloads automatically
4. Content appears immediately

#### Adding New Case Study
1. Copy template from `content/_templates/case-study.md`
2. Fill frontmatter fields
3. Write markdown content
4. Validate: `npm run validate`
5. Auto-discovered by `import.meta.glob()`

#### Adding New Blog Post
1. Create `YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md` in `content/blog/`
2. Add frontmatter (title, date, excerpt, tags)
3. Write markdown content
4. Validate and auto-discovered

#### Theme Development
1. Add CSS variable to `styles/globals.css`
2. Define for both `:root` (dark) and `[data-theme="light"]`
3. Use in components: `var(--your-variable)`
4. Test theme toggle

---

---

### 12. KEY INSIGHTS

1. **Content-First Architecture**: All content lives in structured YAML/markdown, validated by Zod schemas. Components are purely presentational.

2. **Type Safety End-to-End**: Zod schemas â†’ TypeScript types â†’ Component props. No runtime surprises.

3. **CSS Variables for Theming**: Moved away from context-based colors to CSS custom properties. Instant theme switching, no re-renders.

4. **Auto-Discovery Pattern**: `import.meta.glob()` automatically discovers case studies and blog posts. No manual registration needed.

5. **Validation-First Workflow**: `npm run validate` catches errors before they reach production. CLI blocks bad commits.

6. **Modular Component Design**: Large components (CaseStudyModal) refactored into smaller, focused sub-components.

7. **Premium Design System**: Instrument Serif + Sans fonts, glassmorphism, ambient orbs, smooth animations via Framer Motion.

8. **Accessibility Built-In**: Skip links, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, semantic HTML throughout.

9. **Blog as First-Class Feature**: Full reading experience with progress tracking, TOC, code highlighting, likes, and social sharing.

10. **AI-Friendly Documentation**: Comprehensive `/context` directory with architecture, design system, and governance rules for AI agents.

---

This portfolio represents a sophisticated, production-ready React application with a clean separation between content, business logic, and presentation. The architecture prioritizes developer experience, type safety, and maintainability while delivering a premium user experience.

     1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Content Loader with Zod Validation
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * This module provides type-safe access to all content files.
     5â†’ * YAML files are loaded via @rollup/plugin-yaml.
     6â†’ * Case studies are loaded from markdown files with YAML frontmatter.
     7â†’ */
     8â†’
     9â†’import { z } from 'zod';
    10â†’import YAML from 'yaml';
    11â†’import type { PortfolioContent, CaseStudy } from '../types/portfolio';
    12â†’import {
    13â†’  ProfileSchema,
    14â†’  ExperienceSchema,
    15â†’  TestimonialsSchema,
    16â†’  CertificationsSchema,
    17â†’  SkillsSchema,
    18â†’  SocialSchema,
    19â†’  CaseStudySchema,
    20â†’  PassionProjectsSchema,
    21â†’  BlogPostSchema
    22â†’} from './schemas';
    23â†’
    24â†’// Import YAML content files
    25â†’import profileYaml from '../../content/profile.yaml';
    26â†’import experienceYaml from '../../content/experience/index.yaml';
    27â†’import testimonialsYaml from '../../content/testimonials/index.yaml';
    28â†’import certificationsYaml from '../../content/certifications/index.yaml';
    29â†’import skillsYaml from '../../content/skills/index.yaml';
    30â†’import socialYaml from '../../content/social/index.yaml';
    31â†’import passionProjectsYaml from '../../content/passion-projects/index.yaml';
    32â†’
    33â†’// Auto-discover case studies using import.meta.glob (now markdown files)
    34â†’const caseStudyFiles = import.meta.glob('../../content/case-studies/*.md', { query: '?raw', eager: true });
    35â†’
    36â†’// Re-export schemas for backward compatibility
    37â†’export {
    38â†’  ProfileSchema,
    39â†’  ExperienceSchema,
    40â†’  TestimonialsSchema,
    41â†’  CertificationsSchema,
    42â†’  SkillsSchema,
    43â†’  SocialSchema,
    44â†’  CaseStudySchema,
    45â†’  PassionProjectsSchema,
    46â†’  BlogPostSchema
    47â†’};
    48â†’
    49â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    50â†’// Frontmatter Parsing
    51â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    52â†’
    53â†’function parseFrontmatter(raw: string): { frontmatter: Record<string, unknown>; content: string } {
    54â†’  const match = raw.match(/^---\n([\s\S]*?)\n---\n([\s\S]*)$/);
    55â†’  if (!match) return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    56â†’
    57â†’  const frontmatterStr = match[1];
    58â†’  const content = match[2].trim();
    59â†’
    60â†’  try {
    61â†’    const frontmatter = YAML.parse(frontmatterStr);
    62â†’    return { frontmatter, content };
    63â†’  } catch (error) {
    64â†’    console.error('Failed to parse frontmatter:', error);
    65â†’    return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    66â†’  }
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    70â†’// Runtime Validation
    71â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    72â†’
    73â†’function validate<T>(schema: z.ZodSchema<T>, data: unknown, filename: string): T {
    74â†’  try {
    75â†’    return schema.parse(data);
    76â†’  } catch (error) {
    77â†’    if (error instanceof z.ZodError) {
    78â†’      console.error(`âŒ Validation failed for ${filename}:`, error.flatten().fieldErrors);
    79â†’      throw new Error(`Invalid content in ${filename}: ${error.message}`);
    80â†’    }
    81â†’    throw error;
    82â†’  }
    83â†’}
    84â†’
    85â†’// Export validated content
    86â†’export const profile = validate(ProfileSchema, profileYaml, 'profile.yaml');
    87â†’export const experience = validate(ExperienceSchema, experienceYaml, 'experience/index.yaml');
    88â†’export const testimonials = validate(TestimonialsSchema, testimonialsYaml, 'testimonials/index.yaml');
    89â†’export const certifications = validate(CertificationsSchema, certificationsYaml, 'certifications/index.yaml');
    90â†’export const skills = validate(SkillsSchema, skillsYaml, 'skills/index.yaml');
    91â†’export const social = validate(SocialSchema, socialYaml, 'social/index.yaml');
    92â†’export const passionProjectsData = validate(PassionProjectsSchema, passionProjectsYaml, 'passion-projects/index.yaml');
    93â†’export const passionProjects = passionProjectsData.projects;
    94â†’
    95â†’// Parse and validate case studies from markdown files
    96â†’function parseCaseStudies(): CaseStudy[] {
    97â†’  return Object.entries(caseStudyFiles)
    98â†’    .map(([path, module]) => {
    99â†’      const filename = path.split('/').pop() || 'unknown';
   100â†’      const raw = (module as { default: string }).default;
   101â†’      const { frontmatter, content } = parseFrontmatter(raw);
   102â†’      
   103â†’      // Combine frontmatter with content
   104â†’      const caseStudyData = {
   105â†’        ...frontmatter,
   106â†’        content
   107â†’      };
   108â†’      
   109â†’      return validate(CaseStudySchema, caseStudyData, filename);
   110â†’    })
   111â†’    .sort((a, b) => a.id - b.id);
   112â†’}
   113â†’
   114â†’export const caseStudies = parseCaseStudies();
   115â†’
   116â†’// Aggregated content export
   117â†’export const content: PortfolioContent = {
   118â†’  profile,
   119â†’  experience,
   120â†’  testimonials,
   121â†’  certifications,
   122â†’  skills,
   123â†’  social,
   124â†’  caseStudies,
   125â†’  passionProjects,
   126â†’};
   127â†’
   128â†’// Helper functions
   129â†’export function getCaseStudyBySlug(slug: string) {
   130â†’  return caseStudies.find(cs => cs.slug === slug);
   131â†’}
   132â†’
   133â†’export function getCaseStudyById(id: number) {
   134â†’  return caseStudies.find(cs => cs.id === id);
   135â†’}
   136â†’
   137â†’export function getFeaturedTestimonials() {
   138â†’  return testimonials.testimonials.filter(t => t.featured);
   139â†’}
   140â†’
   141â†’export function getFeaturedCertifications() {
   142â†’  return certifications.certifications.filter(c => c.featured);
   143â†’}
   144â†’
   145â†’export function getPrimarySocialLinks() {
   146â†’  return social.links.filter(l => l.primary);
   147â†’}
   148â†’
   149â†’export function isSectionVisible(section: keyof typeof profile.sections): boolean {
   150â†’  return profile.sections[section];
   151â†’}
   152â†’
   153â†’export default content;
   154â†’

   106â†’const ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined);
   107â†’
   108â†’const STORAGE_KEY = 'portfolio-theme';
   109â†’
   110â†’export function ThemeProvider({ children }: { children: ReactNode }) {
   111â†’  const [theme, setTheme] = useState<Theme>(() => {
   112â†’    // Check localStorage first
   113â†’    if (typeof window !== 'undefined') {
   114â†’      const stored = localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY);
   115â†’      if (stored === 'light' || stored === 'dark') {
   116â†’        return stored;
   117â†’      }
   118â†’      // Check system preference
   119â†’      if (window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: light)').matches) {
   120â†’        return 'light';
   121â†’      }
   122â†’    }
   123â†’    return 'dark';
   124â†’  });
   125â†’
   126â†’  useEffect(() => {
   127â†’    localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, theme);
   128â†’
   129â†’    // Set data-theme attribute for CSS custom properties
   130â†’    document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', theme);
   131â†’
   132â†’    // Update meta theme-color
   133â†’    const metaThemeColor = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
   134â†’    if (metaThemeColor) {
   135â†’      metaThemeColor.setAttribute('content', theme === 'dark' ? '#08080a' : '#fafafa');
   136â†’    }
   137â†’
   138â†’    // Update body background for smooth transitions
   139â†’    document.body.style.background = theme === 'dark' ? '#08080a' : '#fafafa';
   140â†’  }, [theme]);
   141â†’
   142â†’  const toggleTheme = () => {
   143â†’    setTheme((prev: Theme) => prev === 'dark' ? 'light' : 'dark');
   144â†’  };
   145â†’
   146â†’  const colors = theme === 'dark' ? darkColors : lightColors;
   147â†’
   148â†’  return (
   149â†’    <ThemeContext.Provider value={{ theme, colors, toggleTheme, isDark: theme === 'dark' }}>
   150â†’      {children}
   151â†’    </ThemeContext.Provider>
   152â†’  );
   153â†’}
   154â†’
   155â†’export function useTheme() {
   156â†’  const context = useContext(ThemeContext);
   157â†’  if (context === undefined) {
   158â†’    throw new Error('useTheme must be used within a ThemeProvider');
   159â†’  }
   160â†’  return context;
   161â†’}
   162â†’
   163â†’export type { ThemeColors, Theme };
   164â†’

    29â†’
    30â†’Losing a single institutional client to a slashing event or compliance failure would damage reputation across the entire institutional marketâ€”a market where trust spreads by word of mouth.
    31â†’
    32â†’## The Challenge
    33â†’
    34â†’ETF providers and asset managers wanted ETH staking yield, but couldn't use existing solutions. Consumer staking products lacked the custody controls, audit trails, and regulatory defensibility that institutional clients require.
    35â†’
    36â†’**The constraints were steep:**
    37â†’- Full custody key ownership required (no third-party key management)
    38â†’- Must pass SOC 2 and regulatory audits
    39â†’- Zero tolerance for slashing events (millions at stake per incident)
    40â†’- Competitive yield expectations within 0.1% of market
    41â†’
    42â†’## The Approach
    43â†’
    44â†’My hypothesis: we could build in-house validator infrastructure that satisfies institutional custody requirements while maintaining competitive yieldsâ€”if we optimized for "boring and defensible" over "innovative and risky."
    45â†’
    46â†’### Alternatives Considered
    47â†’
    48â†’| Option | Trade-offs | Why Not |
    49â†’|--------|------------|---------|
    50â†’| Third-party provider (Figment, Blockdaemon) | Faster launch, battle-tested infra | Custody key control was non-negotiable for ETF-grade compliance |
    51â†’| Single validator client | Simpler operations, unified tooling | Network centralization risk + institutional mandate for resilience |
    52â†’| Maximum yield optimization | Higher APY, competitive differentiation | Introduced unpredictability that institutional clients explicitly didn't want |
    53â†’
    54â†’**Chosen path:** In-house multi-client infrastructure with Web3Signer for air-gapped signing, prioritizing auditability and slashing prevention over yield maximization.
    55â†’
    56â†’## Key Decision
    57â†’
    58â†’**In-house validators vs. staking-as-a-service**
    59â†’
    60â†’Staking providers offered 3-week launch vs our 6-month build. Leadership pressure to ship faster.
    61â†’
    62â†’We chose in-house despite timeline. Presented compliance risk matrix showing third-party key management as audit blocker for ETF clients.
    63â†’
    64â†’> Decision validated when Galaxy specifically cited 'full key ownership' as reason they chose us over competitors using third-party providers.
    65â†’
    66â†’## Execution
    67â†’
    68â†’### Phase 1: Discovery & Requirements (6 weeks)
    69â†’- Conducted 12+ calls with Galaxy and prospective institutional clients to understand non-negotiables
    70â†’- Mapped compliance requirements with legal and created 'custody compatibility matrix'
    71â†’- Evaluated 3 staking-as-a-service providers against institutional requirements
    72â†’
    73â†’### Phase 2: Architecture & Design (4 weeks)
    74â†’- Designed multi-client validator architecture (Lighthouse 40%, Prysm 30%, Teku 20%, Nimbus 10%)
    75â†’- Specified Web3Signer integration for air-gapped signing with slashing protection
    76â†’- Created redundant slashing DB architecture with multiple sources of truth
    77â†’
    78â†’### Phase 3: Build & Integration (8 weeks)
    79â†’- Coordinated engineering sprints across validator infra and custody integration teams
    80â†’- Built sub-second alert systems for potential slashing scenarios
    81â†’- Implemented 'graceful degradation' logicâ€”miss attestations rather than risk slashing
    82â†’
    83â†’### Phase 4: Client Onboarding (6 weeks)
    84â†’- Onboarded Galaxy as design partner, incorporating feedback into MVP
    85â†’- Created operational runbooks for every failure scenario
    86â†’- Documented every architecture decision for audit trail
    87â†’
    88â†’## Results
    89â†’
    90â†’- **Zero slashing events** â€” Across all validators since launchâ€”the only metric that matters for institutional trust
    91â†’- **Galaxy + institutional clients onboarded** â€” Including ETF-adjacent asset managers with billions in AUM
    92â†’- **Yield within 0.1% of market leaders** â€” Proved we didn't sacrifice performance for compliance
    93â†’
    94â†’Established Anchorage as credible institutional staking provider. Created reusable compliance framework now used for other staking products.
    95â†’
    96â†’## What I Learned
    97â†’
    98â†’**What worked:**
    99â†’- Involving compliance from day 1, not as a checkbox at the end
   100â†’- Using Galaxy as design partnerâ€”their feedback caught edge cases we missed
   101â†’- Building extensive documentation as we went (invaluable for audits)
   102â†’- Choosing 'boring and defensible' over clever optimizations
   103â†’
   104â†’**What didn't:**
   105â†’- Initially underestimated validator client diversity overheadâ€”each client has different APIs, DBs, upgrade cycles
   106â†’- First slashing prevention design was over-engineered. Built for scenarios that were theoretically possible but practically irrelevant
   107â†’- Took too long to align legal and compliance on key custody definitions
   108â†’
   109â†’> In regulated crypto infrastructure, the competitive moat isn't technical innovationâ€”it's trust, auditability, and the paper trail that proves you did things right.
   110â†’
   111â†’If I did it again, I'd run a 'compliance design review' as a formal gate before any architecture decisions. We did this informally, but making it explicit would have saved 2-3 weeks of rework.
   112â†’

     1â†’/**
     2â†’ * Blog Post Likes System
     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * Manages like functionality with client-side persistence and tracking.
     5â†’ * Stores like data in localStorage with user tracking information.
     6â†’ */
     7â†’
     8â†’export interface LikeData {
     9â†’    postSlug: string;
    10â†’    count: number;
    11â†’    timestamp: number;
    12â†’    userFingerprint: string;
    13â†’}
    14â†’
    15â†’export interface UserLike {
    16â†’    postSlug: string;
    17â†’    timestamp: number;
    18â†’    userAgent: string;
    19â†’    fingerprintHash: string;
    20â†’}
    21â†’
    22â†’const LIKES_STORAGE_KEY = 'blog-post-likes';
    23â†’const USER_LIKES_KEY = 'user-likes';
    24â†’const USER_FINGERPRINT_KEY = 'user-fingerprint';
    25â†’
    26â†’/**
    27â†’ * Generate a simple fingerprint for the user
    28â†’ * Uses browser characteristics to create a semi-stable identifier
    29â†’ */
    30â†’function generateUserFingerprint(): string {
    31â†’    const canvas = document.createElement('canvas');
    32â†’    const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
    33â†’    if (ctx) {
    34â†’        ctx.textBaseline = 'top';
    35â†’        ctx.font = '14px Arial';
    36â†’        ctx.fillText('fingerprint', 2, 2);
    37â†’    }
    38â†’
    39â†’    const components = [
    40â†’        navigator.userAgent,
    41â†’        navigator.language,
    42â†’        screen.colorDepth,
    43â†’        screen.width + 'x' + screen.height,
    44â†’        new Date().getTimezoneOffset(),
    45â†’        canvas.toDataURL()
    46â†’    ];
    47â†’
    48â†’    // Simple hash function
    49â†’    const str = components.join('|');
    50â†’    let hash = 0;
    51â†’    for (let i = 0; i < str.length; i++) {
    52â†’        const char = str.charCodeAt(i);
    53â†’        hash = ((hash << 5) - hash) + char;
    54â†’        hash = hash & hash;
    55â†’    }
    56â†’
    57â†’    return Math.abs(hash).toString(36);
    58â†’}
    59â†’
    60â†’/**
    61â†’ * Get or create user fingerprint
    62â†’ */
    63â†’function getUserFingerprint(): string {
    64â†’    try {
    65â†’        let fingerprint = localStorage.getItem(USER_FINGERPRINT_KEY);
    66â†’        if (!fingerprint) {
    67â†’            fingerprint = generateUserFingerprint();
    68â†’            localStorage.setItem(USER_FINGERPRINT_KEY, fingerprint);
    69â†’        }
    70â†’        return fingerprint;
    71â†’    } catch {
    72â†’        // Fallback if localStorage is not available
    73â†’        return generateUserFingerprint();
    74â†’    }
    75â†’}
    76â†’
    77â†’/**
    78â†’ * Get all likes from storage
    79â†’ */
    80â†’function getAllLikes(): Record<string, LikeData> {
    81â†’    try {
    82â†’        const data = localStorage.getItem(LIKES_STORAGE_KEY);
    83â†’        return data ? JSON.parse(data) : {};
    84â†’    } catch {
    85â†’        return {};
    86â†’    }
    87â†’}
    88â†’
    89â†’/**
    90â†’ * Save likes to storage
    91â†’ */
    92â†’function saveLikes(likes: Record<string, LikeData>): void {
    93â†’    try {
    94â†’        localStorage.setItem(LIKES_STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify(likes));
    95â†’    } catch (error) {
    96â†’        console.error('Failed to save likes:', error);
    97â†’    }
    98â†’}
    99â†’
   100â†’/**
   101â†’ * Get user's likes from storage
   102â†’ */
   103â†’function getUserLikes(): UserLike[] {
   104â†’    try {
   105â†’        const data = localStorage.getItem(USER_LIKES_KEY);
   106â†’        return data ? JSON.parse(data) : [];
   107â†’    } catch {
   108â†’        return [];
   109â†’    }
   110â†’}
   111â†’
   112â†’/**
   113â†’ * Save user's likes to storage
   114â†’ */
   115â†’function saveUserLikes(userLikes: UserLike[]): void {
   116â†’    try {
   117â†’        localStorage.setItem(USER_LIKES_KEY, JSON.stringify(userLikes));
   118â†’    } catch (error) {
   119â†’        console.error('Failed to save user likes:', error);
   120â†’    }
   121â†’}
   122â†’
   123â†’/**
   124â†’ * Check if user has liked a post
   125â†’ */
   126â†’export function hasUserLikedPost(postSlug: string): boolean {
   127â†’    const userLikes = getUserLikes();
   128â†’    return userLikes.some(like => like.postSlug === postSlug);
   129â†’}
   130â†’
   131â†’/**
   132â†’ * Get like count for a post
   133â†’ */
   134â†’export function getLikeCount(postSlug: string): number {
   135â†’    const likes = getAllLikes();
   136â†’    return likes[postSlug]?.count || 0;
   137â†’}
   138â†’
   139â†’/**
   140â†’ * Like a post (increment count)
   141â†’ */
   142â†’export function likePost(postSlug: string): { count: number; success: boolean } {
   143â†’    try {
   144â†’        // Check if already liked
   145â†’        if (hasUserLikedPost(postSlug)) {
   146â†’            return { count: getLikeCount(postSlug), success: false };
   147â†’        }
   148â†’
   149â†’        const likes = getAllLikes();
   150â†’        const fingerprint = getUserFingerprint();
   151â†’        const timestamp = Date.now();
   152â†’
   153â†’        // Update like count
   154â†’        if (!likes[postSlug]) {
   155â†’            likes[postSlug] = {
   156â†’                postSlug,
   157â†’                count: 0,
   158â†’                timestamp,
   159â†’                userFingerprint: fingerprint
   160â†’            };
   161â†’        }
   162â†’        likes[postSlug].count += 1;
   163â†’        saveLikes(likes);
   164â†’
   165â†’        // Track user's like
   166â†’        const userLikes = getUserLikes();
   167â†’        userLikes.push({
   168â†’            postSlug,
   169â†’            timestamp,
   170â†’            userAgent: navigator.userAgent,
   171â†’            fingerprintHash: fingerprint
   172â†’        });
   173â†’        saveUserLikes(userLikes);
   174â†’
   175â†’        return { count: likes[postSlug].count, success: true };
   176â†’    } catch (error) {
   177â†’        console.error('Failed to like post:', error);
   178â†’        return { count: getLikeCount(postSlug), success: false };
   179â†’    }
   180â†’}
   181â†’
   182â†’/**
   183â†’ * Unlike a post (decrement count)
   184â†’ */
   185â†’export function unlikePost(postSlug: string): { count: number; success: boolean } {
   186â†’    try {
   187â†’        // Check if user has liked this post
   188â†’        if (!hasUserLikedPost(postSlug)) {
   189â†’            return { count: getLikeCount(postSlug), success: false };
   190â†’        }
   191â†’
   192â†’        const likes = getAllLikes();
   193â†’
   194â†’        // Decrement count
   195â†’        if (likes[postSlug] && likes[postSlug].count > 0) {
   196â†’            likes[postSlug].count -= 1;
   197â†’            saveLikes(likes);
   198â†’        }
   199â†’
   200â†’        // Remove from user's likes
   201â†’        const userLikes = getUserLikes();
   202â†’        const updatedUserLikes = userLikes.filter(like => like.postSlug !== postSlug);
   203â†’        saveUserLikes(updatedUserLikes);
   204â†’
   205â†’        return { count: likes[postSlug]?.count || 0, success: true };
   206â†’    } catch (error) {
   207â†’        console.error('Failed to unlike post:', error);
   208â†’        return { count: getLikeCount(postSlug), success: false };
   209â†’    }
   210â†’}
   211â†’
   212â†’/**
   213â†’ * Get all posts with likes (for analytics)
   214â†’ */
   215â†’export function getAllPostLikes(): LikeData[] {
   216â†’    const likes = getAllLikes();
   217â†’    return Object.values(likes).sort((a, b) => b.count - a.count);
   218â†’}
   219â†’
   220â†’/**
   221â†’ * Get all user likes (for analytics)
   222â†’ */
   223â†’export function getAllUserLikes(): UserLike[] {
   224â†’    return getUserLikes().sort((a, b) => b.timestamp - a.timestamp);
   225â†’}
   226â†’
   227â†’/**
   228â†’ * Export likes data as JSON (for backup/analysis)
   229â†’ */
   230â†’export function exportLikesData(): string {
   231â†’    return JSON.stringify({
   232â†’        postLikes: getAllPostLikes(),
   233â†’        userLikes: getAllUserLikes(),
   234â†’        exportDate: new Date().toISOString()
   235â†’    }, null, 2);
   236â†’}
   237â†’
   238â†’/**
   239â†’ * Get like analytics for a specific post
   240â†’ */
   241â†’export function getPostLikeAnalytics(postSlug: string): {
   242â†’    count: number;
   243â†’    userLikes: UserLike[];
   244â†’    firstLikeDate: Date | null;
   245â†’    lastLikeDate: Date | null;
   246â†’} {
   247â†’    const count = getLikeCount(postSlug);
   248â†’    const userLikes = getAllUserLikes().filter(like => like.postSlug === postSlug);
   249â†’
   250â†’    let firstLikeDate = null;
   251â†’    let lastLikeDate = null;
   252â†’
   253â†’    if (userLikes.length > 0) {
   254â†’        const timestamps = userLikes.map(like => like.timestamp);
   255â†’        firstLikeDate = new Date(Math.min(...timestamps));
   256â†’        lastLikeDate = new Date(Math.max(...timestamps));
   257â†’    }
   258â†’
   259â†’    return {
   260â†’        count,
   261â†’        userLikes,
   262â†’        firstLikeDate,
   263â†’        lastLikeDate
   264â†’    };
   265â†’}

     1â†’import { useState } from 'react';
     2â†’import type { BlogPost } from '../types/blog';
     3â†’import BlogPostModal from './BlogPostModal';
     4â†’
     5â†’// Auto-discover blog posts using import.meta.glob
     6â†’const blogPostFiles = import.meta.glob('../../content/blog/*.md', { query: '?raw', eager: true });
     7â†’
     8â†’interface BlogProps {
     9â†’    isMobile: boolean;
    10â†’    isTablet: boolean;
    11â†’}
    12â†’
    13â†’// Parse frontmatter from markdown
    14â†’function parseFrontmatter(raw: string): { frontmatter: Record<string, unknown>; content: string } {
    15â†’    const match = raw.match(/^---\n([\s\S]*?)\n---\n([\s\S]*)$/);
    16â†’    if (!match) return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    17â†’
    18â†’    const frontmatterStr = match[1];
    19â†’    const content = match[2];
    20â†’
    21â†’    const frontmatter: Record<string, unknown> = {};
    22â†’    const lines = frontmatterStr.split('\n');
    23â†’
    24â†’    for (const line of lines) {
    25â†’        const colonIndex = line.indexOf(':');
    26â†’        if (colonIndex === -1) continue;
    27â†’
    28â†’        const key = line.slice(0, colonIndex).trim();
    29â†’        let value = line.slice(colonIndex + 1).trim();
    30â†’
    31â†’        // Handle arrays
    32â†’        if (value.startsWith('[') && value.endsWith(']')) {
    33â†’            const arrayContent = value.slice(1, -1);
    34â†’            frontmatter[key] = arrayContent.split(',').map(item =>
    35â†’                item.trim().replace(/^["']|["']$/g, '')
    36â†’            );
    37â†’        }
    38â†’        // Handle quoted strings
    39â†’        else if (value.startsWith('"') && value.endsWith('"')) {
    40â†’            frontmatter[key] = value.slice(1, -1);
    41â†’        }
    42â†’        // Handle null
    43â†’        else if (value === 'null') {
    44â†’            frontmatter[key] = null;
    45â†’        }
    46â†’        // Regular string
    47â†’        else {
    48â†’            frontmatter[key] = value;
    49â†’        }
    50â†’    }
    51â†’
    52â†’    return { frontmatter, content };
    53â†’}
    54â†’
    55â†’// Calculate reading time
    56â†’function calculateReadingTime(content: string): number {
    57â†’    const wordsPerMinute = 200;
    58â†’    const words = content.split(/\s+/).length;
    59â†’    return Math.ceil(words / wordsPerMinute);
    60â†’}
    61â†’
    62â†’// Extract slug from filename (YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md â†’ slug)
    63â†’function extractSlugFromFilename(path: string): string {
    64â†’    const filename = path.split('/').pop() || '';
    65â†’    // Remove .md extension and date prefix (YYYY-MM-DD-)
    66â†’    return filename.replace(/^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}-/, '').replace(/\.md$/, '');
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’// Parse all blog posts (auto-discovered)
    70â†’function parseBlogPosts(): BlogPost[] {
    71â†’    const posts = Object.entries(blogPostFiles).map(([path, module]) => {
    72â†’        const raw = (module as any).default as string;
    73â†’        const slug = extractSlugFromFilename(path);
    74â†’        const { frontmatter, content } = parseFrontmatter(raw);
    75â†’
    76â†’        return {
    77â†’            slug,
    78â†’            title: frontmatter.title as string || 'Untitled',
    79â†’            date: frontmatter.date as string || new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0],
    80â†’            excerpt: frontmatter.excerpt as string || '',
    81â†’            tags: (frontmatter.tags as string[]) || [],
    82â†’            thumbnail: frontmatter.thumbnail as string | null || null,
    83â†’            readingTime: calculateReadingTime(content),
    84â†’            content
    85â†’        };
    86â†’    });
    87â†’
    88â†’    return posts.sort((a, b) => new Date(b.date).getTime() - new Date(a.date).getTime());
    89â†’}
    90â†’
    91â†’export default function Blog({ isMobile, isTablet }: BlogProps) {
    92â†’    const [hoveredPost, setHoveredPost] = useState<string | null>(null);
    93â†’    const [selectedPost, setSelectedPost] = useState<BlogPost | null>(null);
    94â†’
    95â†’    const posts = parseBlogPosts();
    96â†’
    97â†’    const formatDate = (dateStr: string) => {
    98â†’        const date = new Date(dateStr);
    99â†’        return date.toLocaleDateString('en-US', {
   100â†’            month: '2-digit',
   101â†’            day: '2-digit',
   102â†’            year: '2-digit'
   103â†’        }).replace(/\//g, '.');
   104â†’    };
   105â†’
   106â†’    const handleNavigate = (direction: 'prev' | 'next') => {
   107â†’        if (!selectedPost) return;
   108â†’        const currentIndex = posts.findIndex(p => p.slug === selectedPost.slug);
   109â†’        const newIndex = direction === 'prev' ? currentIndex - 1 : currentIndex + 1;
   110â†’        if (newIndex >= 0 && newIndex < posts.length) {
   111â†’            setSelectedPost(posts[newIndex]);
   112â†’        }
   113â†’    };
   114â†’
   115â†’    const getRelatedPosts = (currentPost: BlogPost): BlogPost[] => {
   116â†’        if (!currentPost.tags || currentPost.tags.length === 0) return [];
   117â†’
   118â†’        // Find posts with shared tags, excluding current post
   119â†’        const relatedPosts = posts
   120â†’            .filter(post => post.slug !== currentPost.slug)
   121â†’            .map(post => {
   122â†’                const sharedTags = post.tags.filter(tag => currentPost.tags.includes(tag));
   123â†’                return { post, sharedTagCount: sharedTags.length };
   124â†’            })
   125â†’            .filter(({ sharedTagCount }) => sharedTagCount > 0)
   126â†’            .sort((a, b) => b.sharedTagCount - a.sharedTagCount)
   127â†’            .slice(0, 3) // Max 3 related posts
   128â†’            .map(({ post }) => post);
   129â†’
   130â†’        return relatedPosts;
   131â†’    };
   132â†’
   133â†’    const sectionPadding = isMobile ? '48px 24px' : isTablet ? '64px 40px' : '80px 64px';
   134â†’
   135â†’    return (
   136â†’        <>
   137â†’            <section id="blog" style={{
   138â†’                padding: sectionPadding,
   139â†’                maxWidth: 'var(--layout-max-width)',
   140â†’                margin: '0 auto',
   141â†’                position: 'relative',
   142â†’                zIndex: 1
   143â†’            }}>
   144â†’                {/* Section label */}
   145â†’                <div style={{
   146â†’                    display: 'flex',
   147â†’                    alignItems: 'center',
   148â†’                    gap: 'var(--space-lg)',
   149â†’                    marginBottom: isMobile ? 'var(--space-xl)' : '40px'
   150â†’                }}>
   151â†’                    <span style={{
   152â†’                        fontSize: '11px',
   153â†’                        fontWeight: 600,
   154â†’                        letterSpacing: '0.15em',
   155â†’                        textTransform: 'uppercase',
   156â†’                        color: 'var(--color-text-muted)'
   157â†’                    }}>
   158â†’                        Insights
   159â†’                    </span>
   160â†’                    <div style={{
   161â†’                        flex: 1,
   162â†’                        height: '1px',
   163â†’                        background: 'var(--color-border-light)'
   164â†’                    }} />
   165â†’                </div>
   166â†’
   167â†’                {/* Section header */}
   168â†’                <div style={{
   169â†’                    marginBottom: isMobile ? 'var(--space-xl)' : 'var(--space-2xl)'
   170â†’                }}>
   171â†’                    <h2 style={{
   172â†’                        fontSize: isMobile ? '28px' : isTablet ? '36px' : '42px',
   173â†’                        fontFamily: 'var(--font-serif)',
   174â†’                        fontWeight: 400,
   175â†’                        fontStyle: 'italic',
   176â†’                        color: 'var(--color-text-primary)',
   177â†’                        marginBottom: 'var(--space-md)',
   178â†’                        letterSpacing: '-0.02em',
   179â†’                        lineHeight: 1.2
   180â†’                    }}>
   181â†’                        Thoughts on building at the edge
   182â†’                    </h2>
   183â†’                    <p style={{
   184â†’                        fontSize: '15px',
   185â†’                        color: 'var(--color-text-tertiary)',
   186â†’                        maxWidth: '600px',

     1â†’# Web3 Portfolio Design System
     2â†’
     3â†’A comprehensive design system for a Web3 product manager portfolio featuring dark and light modes with elegant typography and consistent spacing.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Features
     6â†’
     7â†’- ğŸ¨ **Dual Theme Support**: Seamless dark and light mode switching
     8â†’- ğŸ”¤ **Premium Typography**: Instrument Serif & Instrument Sans font pairing
     9â†’- ğŸ“ **Consistent Spacing**: Token-based spacing system
    10â†’- ğŸ§© **Reusable Components**: Production-ready React components
    11â†’- âœ¨ **Smooth Animations**: Premium easing and transitions
    12â†’- ğŸ“± **Fully Responsive**: Mobile, tablet, and desktop optimized
    13â†’
    14â†’## ğŸš¨ Governance ("The Prime Directive")
    15â†’**The Design System is the Single Source of Truth.**
    16â†’*   **Do not** use hardcoded values in components.
    17â†’*   **Do not** add "snowflake" styles without justification.
    18â†’*   **Updates**: If you need a new style, add it to `globals.css` AND document it here first.
    19â†’
    20â†’## Quick Start
    21â†’
    22â†’### Theme System
    23â†’
    24â†’The design system uses CSS custom properties for theming. Toggle between dark and light modes using the `ThemeToggle` component.

    28â†’

   346â†’## Best Practices
   347â†’
   348â†’1. **Always use CSS variables** for colors and spacing
   349â†’2. **Use semantic component names** for clarity
   350â†’3. **Maintain consistent spacing** using the token system
   351â†’4. **Test both themes** when adding new components
   352â†’5. **Follow responsive patterns** established in the system
   353â†’6. **Use proper semantic HTML** for accessibility
   354â†’7. **Leverage the easing functions** for consistent animations
   355â†’
   356â†’## Customization
   357â†’
   358â†’### Changing Colors
   359â†’
   360â†’Edit the CSS variables in `/styles/globals.css`:
   361â†’
   362â†’```css
   363â†’:root {
   364â†’  --color-accent: #your-color;
   365â†’}
   366â†’
   367â†’[data-theme="light"] {
   368â†’  --color-accent: #your-light-color;
   369â†’}
   370â†’```
   371â†’
   372â†’### Adding New Components
   373â†’
   374â†’1. Create component in `/components`
   375â†’2. Add styles to `/components/components.css`
   376â†’3. Use existing design tokens
   377â†’4. Test in both themes
   378â†’5. Ensure responsive behavior
   379â†’

```
     1â†’---
     2â†’title: "Why Content Validation Matters for Developer Portfolios"
     3â†’date: "2024-12-15"
     4â†’excerpt: "Building a portfolio is easy. Maintaining content quality at scale is hard. Here's how automated validation saves time and prevents embarrassing mistakes."
     5â†’tags: ["Developer Tools", "Best Practices", "Automation"]
     6â†’thumbnail: null
     7â†’---
     8â†’
     9â†’I've seen too many portfolios with broken links, malformed YAML, and inconsistent data structures. The solution isn't "be more careful"â€”it's automation.
    10â†’
    11â†’## The Problem with Manual Validation
    12â†’
    13â†’When you're managing a portfolio with multiple content types (case studies, blog posts, projects), manual checking doesn't scale:
    14â†’
    15â†’**Common mistakes:**
    16â†’- Typos in YAML keys (`compnay` instead of `company`)
    17â†’- Wrong date formats (`12/15/2024` vs. `2024-12-15`)
    18â†’- Missing required fields that crash builds
    19â†’- Duplicate IDs between case studies
    20â†’- Invalid URLs that go unnoticed
    21â†’
    22â†’These errors often don't surface until:
    23â†’1. Your build fails in CI/CD
    24â†’2. A recruiter clicks a broken link
    25â†’3. Your case study drawer shows `undefined`
    26â†’
    27â†’By then, it's too late.
    28â†’
    29â†’## The Solution: Schema Validation
    30â†’
    31â†’The answer is **Zod schemas** combined with a validation CLI.
    32â†’
    33â†’### What This Looks Like
    34â†’
    35â†’```typescript
    36â†’// Define your schema once
    37â†’const CaseStudySchema = z.object({
    38â†’  id: z.number(),
    39â†’  title: z.string(),
    40â†’  year: z.string(),
    41â†’  // ... all your fields
    42â†’});
    43â†’
    44â†’// Validate before commit
    45â†’validateFile(caseStudy, CaseStudySchema);
    46â†’```
    47â†’
    48â†’### Benefits
    49â†’
    50â†’1. **Catch errors early** - Before they reach production
    51â†’2. **Self-documenting** - Schema is your source of truth
    52â†’3. **Type safety** - TypeScript types derived from schemas
    53â†’4. **Fast feedback** - Run validation in <1 second
    54â†’5. **CI/CD integration** - Block bad commits automatically
    55â†’
    56â†’## Real-World Example
    57â†’
    58â†’Here's what validation caught in my portfolio:
    59â†’
    60â†’```bash
    61â†’npm run validate
    62â†’
    63â†’âœ— Case Study: 05-new-project.md
    64â†’  âœ— hook.impactMetric.value: Required
    65â†’  âœ— year: Expected YYYY or YYYY-YY format
    66â†’  âœ— cta.action: Invalid enum value
    67â†’```
    68â†’
    69â†’Without validation, these would have crashed my build or shown broken UI.
    70â†’
    71â†’## Implementation
    72â†’
    73â†’**1. Define schemas:**
    74â†’```typescript
    75â†’export const CaseStudySchema = z.object({
    76â†’  id: z.number(),
    77â†’  slug: z.string(),
    78â†’  title: z.string(),
    79â†’  company: z.string(),
    80â†’  year: z.string(),
    81â†’  // ...
    82â†’});
    83â†’```
    84â†’
    85â†’**2. Create validation script:**
    86â†’```typescript
    87â†’function validateContent() {
    88â†’  const files = readAllContent();
    89â†’  files.forEach(file => {
    90â†’    const result = schema.safeParse(file);
    91â†’    if (!result.success) {
    92â†’      console.error(result.error);
    93â†’      process.exit(1);
    94â†’    }
    95â†’  });
    96â†’}
    97â†’```
    98â†’
    99â†’**3. Add to package.json:**
   100â†’```json
   101â†’{
   102â†’  "scripts": {
   103â†’    "validate": "tsx scripts/validate-content.ts"
   104â†’  }
   105â†’}
   106â†’```
   107â†’
   108â†’**4. Run before commits:**
   109â†’```bash
   110â†’npm run validate
   111â†’git commit -m "Add new case study"
   112â†’```
   113â†’
   114â†’## Beyond Portfolios
   115â†’
   116â†’This pattern works for any content-driven application:
   117â†’- Documentation sites
   118â†’- Blog platforms
   119â†’- Product catalogs
   120â†’- Configuration management
   121â†’
   122â†’The key insight: **treat content as code**.
   123â†’
   124â†’## Key Takeaways
   125â†’
   126â†’1. **Validation is infrastructure** - Not optional, it's foundational
   127â†’2. **Fail fast** - Catch errors locally, not in production
   128â†’3. **Automate everything** - Manual checks don't scale
   129â†’4. **Use types** - Schemas + TypeScript = confidence
   130â†’
   131â†’## Next Steps
   132â†’
   133â†’If you're maintaining a content-heavy portfolio:
   134â†’
   135â†’1. âœ… Add Zod to your project
   136â†’2. âœ… Define schemas for each content type
   137â†’3. âœ… Write validation script
   138â†’4. âœ… Run validation in CI/CD
   139â†’5. âœ… Create templates with correct structure
   140â†’
   141â†’Your future self will thank you when you're adding your 20th case study and the CLI catches a missing field before your recruiter sees a broken page.
   142â†’
   143â†’---
   144â†’

   146â†’

     1â†’#!/usr/bin/env tsx
     2â†’/**
     3â†’ * Content Validation CLI
     4â†’ *
     5â†’ * Validates all portfolio content files against Zod schemas.
     6â†’ * Run before committing to catch content errors early.
     7â†’ *
     8â†’ * Usage:
     9â†’ *   npm run validate
    10â†’ */
    11â†’
    12â†’import { readFileSync, readdirSync } from 'fs';
    13â†’import { join } from 'path';
    14â†’import YAML from 'yaml';
    15â†’import { z } from 'zod';
    16â†’import {
    17â†’  ProfileSchema,
    18â†’  ExperienceSchema,
    19â†’  TestimonialsSchema,
    20â†’  CertificationsSchema,
    21â†’  SkillsSchema,
    22â†’  SocialSchema,
    23â†’  CaseStudySchema,
    24â†’  PassionProjectsSchema,
    25â†’  BlogPostSchema
    26â†’} from '../src/lib/schemas.js';
    27â†’
    28â†’// ANSI color codes for terminal output
    29â†’const colors = {
    30â†’  reset: '\x1b[0m',
    31â†’  green: '\x1b[32m',
    32â†’  red: '\x1b[31m',
    33â†’  yellow: '\x1b[33m',
    34â†’  blue: '\x1b[34m',
    35â†’  gray: '\x1b[90m'
    36â†’};
    37â†’
    38â†’interface ValidationResult {
    39â†’  file: string;
    40â†’  success: boolean;
    41â†’  errors?: string[];
    42â†’}
    43â†’
    44â†’// Parse frontmatter from markdown
    45â†’function parseFrontmatter(raw: string): { frontmatter: Record<string, unknown>; content: string } {
    46â†’  const match = raw.match(/^---\n([\s\S]*?)\n---\n([\s\S]*)$/);
    47â†’  if (!match) return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    48â†’
    49â†’  const frontmatterStr = match[1];
    50â†’  const content = match[2].trim();
    51â†’
    52â†’  try {
    53â†’    const frontmatter = YAML.parse(frontmatterStr);
    54â†’    return { frontmatter, content };
    55â†’  } catch (error) {
    56â†’    console.error('Failed to parse frontmatter:', error);
    57â†’    return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    58â†’  }
    59â†’}
    60â†’
    61â†’// Validate a single file against a Zod schema
    62â†’function validateFile(
    63â†’  filePath: string,
    64â†’  schema: z.ZodSchema,
    65â†’  data: unknown
    66â†’): ValidationResult {
    67â†’  try {
    68â†’    schema.parse(data);
    69â†’    return { file: filePath, success: true };
    70â†’  } catch (error) {
    71â†’    if (error instanceof z.ZodError) {
    72â†’      const errors = error.errors.map(err => {
    73â†’        const path = err.path.join('.');
    74â†’        return `  ${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} ${path}: ${err.message}`;
    75â†’      });
    76â†’      return { file: filePath, success: false, errors };
    77â†’    }
    78â†’    return {
    79â†’      file: filePath,
    80â†’      success: false,
    81â†’      errors: [`  ${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} Unknown error: ${error}`]
    82â†’    };
    83â†’  }
    84â†’}
    85â†’
    86â†’// Validate YAML files
    87â†’function validateYamlFile(filePath: string, schema: z.ZodSchema): ValidationResult {
    88â†’  try {
    89â†’    const content = readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8');
    90â†’    const data = YAML.parse(content);
    91â†’    return validateFile(filePath, schema, data);
    92â†’  } catch (error) {
    93â†’    return {
    94â†’      file: filePath,
    95â†’      success: false,
    96â†’      errors: [`  ${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} Failed to read/parse: ${error}`]
    97â†’    };
    98â†’  }
    99â†’}
   100â†’
   101â†’// Validate markdown files with frontmatter
   102â†’function validateMarkdownFile(filePath: string, schema: z.ZodSchema): ValidationResult {
   103â†’  try {
   104â†’    const content = readFileSync(filePath, 'utf-8');
   105â†’    const { frontmatter, content: body } = parseFrontmatter(content);
   106â†’
   107â†’    // Combine frontmatter with content for validation
   108â†’    const data = { ...frontmatter, content: body };
   109â†’    return validateFile(filePath, schema, data);
   110â†’  } catch (error) {
   111â†’    return {
   112â†’      file: filePath,
   113â†’      success: false,
   114â†’      errors: [`  ${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} Failed to read/parse: ${error}`]
   115â†’    };
   116â†’  }
   117â†’}
   118â†’
   119â†’// Main validation function
   120â†’async function validateAllContent(): Promise<void> {
   121â†’  console.log(`${colors.blue}Validating portfolio content...${colors.reset}\n`);
   122â†’
   123â†’  const results: ValidationResult[] = [];
   124â†’  const contentDir = join(process.cwd(), 'content');
   125â†’
   126â†’  // Validate single YAML files
   127â†’  const singleYamlFiles = [
   128â†’    { path: 'profile.yaml', schema: ProfileSchema, label: 'Profile' },
   129â†’    { path: 'experience/index.yaml', schema: ExperienceSchema, label: 'Experience' },
   130â†’    { path: 'testimonials/index.yaml', schema: TestimonialsSchema, label: 'Testimonials' },
   131â†’    { path: 'certifications/index.yaml', schema: CertificationsSchema, label: 'Certifications' },
   132â†’    { path: 'skills/index.yaml', schema: SkillsSchema, label: 'Skills' },
   133â†’    { path: 'social/index.yaml', schema: SocialSchema, label: 'Social' },
   134â†’    { path: 'passion-projects/index.yaml', schema: PassionProjectsSchema, label: 'Passion Projects' }
   135â†’  ];
   136â†’
   137â†’  console.log(`${colors.gray}Validating YAML files...${colors.reset}`);
   138â†’  for (const { path, schema, label } of singleYamlFiles) {
   139â†’    const fullPath = join(contentDir, path);
   140â†’    const result = validateYamlFile(fullPath, schema);
   141â†’    results.push(result);
   142â†’
   143â†’    if (result.success) {
   144â†’      console.log(`${colors.green}âœ“${colors.reset} ${label} (${path})`);
   145â†’    } else {
   146â†’      console.log(`${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} ${label} (${path})`);
   147â†’      result.errors?.forEach(err => console.log(err));
   148â†’    }
   149â†’  }
   150â†’
   151â†’  // Validate case studies
   152â†’  console.log(`\n${colors.gray}Validating case studies...${colors.reset}`);
   153â†’  const caseStudiesDir = join(contentDir, 'case-studies');
   154â†’  const caseStudyFiles = readdirSync(caseStudiesDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('.md'));
   155â†’
   156â†’  for (const file of caseStudyFiles) {
   157â†’    const fullPath = join(caseStudiesDir, file);
   158â†’    const result = validateMarkdownFile(fullPath, CaseStudySchema);
   159â†’    results.push(result);
   160â†’
   161â†’    if (result.success) {
   162â†’      console.log(`${colors.green}âœ“${colors.reset} Case Study: ${file}`);
   163â†’    } else {
   164â†’      console.log(`${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} Case Study: ${file}`);
   165â†’      result.errors?.forEach(err => console.log(err));
   166â†’    }
   167â†’  }
   168â†’
   169â†’  // Validate blog posts
   170â†’  console.log(`\n${colors.gray}Validating blog posts...${colors.reset}`);
   171â†’  const blogDir = join(contentDir, 'blog');
   172â†’  const blogFiles = readdirSync(blogDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('.md'));
   173â†’
   174â†’  for (const file of blogFiles) {
   175â†’    const fullPath = join(blogDir, file);
   176â†’    const result = validateMarkdownFile(fullPath, BlogPostSchema);
   177â†’    results.push(result);
   178â†’
   179â†’    if (result.success) {
   180â†’      console.log(`${colors.green}âœ“${colors.reset} Blog Post: ${file}`);
   181â†’    } else {
   182â†’      console.log(`${colors.red}âœ—${colors.reset} Blog Post: ${file}`);
   183â†’      result.errors?.forEach(err => console.log(err));
   184â†’    }
   185â†’  }
   186â†’
   187â†’  // Summary
   188â†’  const passed = results.filter(r => r.success).length;
   189â†’  const failed = results.filter(r => !r.success).length;
   190â†’
   191â†’  console.log('\n' + 'â”€'.repeat(50));
   192â†’  if (failed === 0) {
   193â†’    console.log(`${colors.green}âœ“ All ${passed} content files validated successfully!${colors.reset}`);
   194â†’    process.exit(0);
   195â†’  } else {
   196â†’    console.log(`${colors.red}âœ— ${failed} file(s) failed validation${colors.reset}`);
   197â†’    console.log(`${colors.green}âœ“ ${passed} file(s) passed${colors.reset}`);
   198â†’    process.exit(1);
   199â†’  }
   200â†’}
   201â†’
   202â†’// Run validation
   203â†’validateAllContent().catch((error) => {
   204â†’  console.error(`${colors.red}Fatal error:${colors.reset}`, error);
   205â†’  process.exit(1);
   206â†’});
   207â†’

## Comprehensive Portfolio Codebase Architecture Report

### 1. PROJECT OVERVIEW

**Type**: React 19 + TypeScript + Vite Single Page Application (SPA)
**Purpose**: Personal portfolio for Dmitrii Fotesco, Senior Technical PM
**Architecture**: Content-driven portfolio with YAML/MDX content management
**URL**: fotesco.dev
**Tech Stack**:
- React 19.2.0 with React DOM
- TypeScript with strict mode
- Vite 7.2.4 (build tool)
- Zod 4.1.13 (validation)
- Framer Motion 12.23.26 (animations)
- React Helmet Async (SEO)
- Gray Matter & YAML (content parsing)
- Vitest 3.2.4 (testing)

---

### 2. DIRECTORY STRUCTURE

```
portfolio/
â”œâ”€â”€ content/                    # Content Layer (YAML + Markdown)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ profile.yaml           # Main profile data (hero, about, sections config)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ experience/index.yaml  # Work history
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ testimonials/index.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ certifications/index.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ skills/index.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ social/index.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ passion-projects/index.yaml
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ case-studies/*.md      # 6 case studies with frontmatter
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ blog/*.md              # 4 blog posts with frontmatter
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ _templates/            # Content templates
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lib/                   # Data Layer
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ content.ts         # Content loader + validation orchestrator
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ schemas.ts         # Zod schemas for all content types
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ likes.ts           # Blog like system (localStorage)
â”‚   â”‚
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ types/                 # TypeScript definitions
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ portfolio.ts       # Main content types
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ blog.ts           # Blog post types
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ yaml.d.ts         # YAML module declarations
â”‚   â”‚
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/            # UI Components

```

---

### 4. KEY ARCHITECTURAL PATTERNS

#### A. Content Schema Validation Flow

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/lib/schemas.ts
- Defines Zod schemas for 9 content types
- Shared between runtime validation and CLI validation
- Ensures type safety from content to component

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/lib/content.ts
- Imports YAML via Vite plugin: `import profileYaml from '../../content/profile.yaml'`
- Auto-discovers markdown files: `import.meta.glob('../../content/case-studies/*.md')`
- Validates at import time with `validate()` function
- Exports typed, validated content objects

**CLI Tool**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/scripts/validate-content.ts
- Command: `npm run validate`
- Validates all YAML and markdown files before commit
- Exit code 1 if validation fails (blocks CI/CD)

#### B. Markdown Frontmatter Processing

**Pattern**: YAML Frontmatter + Markdown Body

Example from case study:
```yaml
---
id: 1
slug: institutional-eth-staking
title: Institutional ETH Staking
company: Anchorage Digital
year: 2024â€“25
tags: [Staking, Custody, ETF-Grade]
hook:
  headline: Built ETF-grade staking infrastructure
  impactMetric:
    value: "Zero"
    label: slashing events
---
## The Challenge
[Markdown content here...]
```

**Processing**:
1. `parseFrontmatter()` extracts YAML and content via regex
2. YAML.parse() converts frontmatter to object
3. Combine: `{ ...frontmatter, content: markdownBody }`
4. Validate with Zod schema
5. Pass to components

#### C. Theme System Architecture

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/context/ThemeContext.tsx

```typescript
// State management
const [theme, setTheme] = useState<'dark' | 'light'>(
  // Priority: localStorage > system preference > 'dark'
)

// Side effects
useEffect(() => {
  document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', theme)
  localStorage.setItem('portfolio-theme', theme)
})
```

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/styles/globals.css

```css
:root {
  --color-background: #08080a;  /* Dark mode default */
  --color-accent: #c29a6c;
}

[data-theme="light"] {
  --color-background: #fafafa;  /* Light mode override */
  --color-accent: #8a6642;
}
```

**Component Usage**:
```tsx
<div style={{ 
  background: 'var(--color-background)',
  color: 'var(--color-text-primary)' 
}} />
```

**Migration Note**: Previously used `useTheme().colors` (deprecated). Now uses CSS variables exclusively.

#### D. Component Communication Patterns

**State Lifting**: Portfolio.tsx manages global state
```tsx
const [modalCase, setModalCase] = useState<CaseStudy | null>(null)
const [hoveredCase, setHoveredCase] = useState<number | null>(null)
```

**Prop Drilling**: Pass callbacks and state to child sections
```tsx
<CaseStudiesSection
  hoveredCase={hoveredCase}
  setHoveredCase={setHoveredCase}
  onCaseClick={(study) => setModalCase(study)}
/>
```

**Modal Pattern**: Conditional rendering with backdrop
```tsx
{modalCase && (
  <CaseStudyDrawer
    isOpen={!!modalCase}
    onClose={() => setModalCase(null)}
    caseStudy={modalCase}
  />
)}
```

---

### 5. CONTENT SCHEMAS & TYPES

**Core Content Types** (defined in /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/types/portfolio.ts):

1. **Profile** - Hero, about, section visibility flags
2. **Experience** - Job history with highlights
3. **Testimonials** - Client/colleague reviews
4. **Certifications** - Professional credentials + onchain identity
5. **Skills** - Categorized skill lists
6. **Social** - Social links + contact CTA
7. **CaseStudy** - Project case studies with metrics
8. **PassionProject** - Side projects
9. **BlogPost** - Blog posts with tags

**Key Schema Features**:
- Optional fields with `.optional()` or `.nullable()`
- Enum validation: `z.enum(['contact', 'calendly', 'linkedin'])`
- Date format validation: `z.string().regex(/^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}$/)`
- Nested objects with structured data
- Array validation with type constraints

**Aggregated Content Interface**:
```typescript
interface PortfolioContent {
  profile: Profile;
  experience: Experience;
  testimonials: Testimonials;
  certifications: Certifications;
  skills: Skills;
  social: Social;
  caseStudies: CaseStudy[];
  passionProjects: PassionProject[];
}
```

---

### 6. COMPONENT ARCHITECTURE

#### Section Components (8 files in src/components/sections/)

**Pattern**: All receive `isMobile`, `isTablet`, `sectionPadding` props

1. **HeroSection.tsx** - Large serif headline with status indicator
2. **AboutSection.tsx** - Bio + stats grid
3. **ExperienceSection.tsx** - Timeline of jobs
4. **CertificationsSection.tsx** - Credential cards + ENS identity
5. **CaseStudiesSection.tsx** - Case study grid with hover states
6. **PassionProjectsSection.tsx** - Side project cards
7. **TestimonialsSection.tsx** - Client testimonials
8. **FooterSection.tsx** - Footer with social links

#### Case Study Drawer Components (7 files in src/components/case-study/)

**Architecture**: Modular drawer split into sub-components

1. **CaseStudyDrawer.tsx** - Main container with slide-in animation
2. **CaseStudyHeader.tsx** - Close button + navigation
3. **CaseStudyHero.tsx** - Thumbnail + title
4. **CaseStudyMetrics.tsx** - Impact metrics display
5. **CaseStudyLinks.tsx** - External links (demo, GitHub, docs, media)
6. **CaseStudyContent.tsx** - Markdown rendering
7. **CaseStudyFooter.tsx** - CTA + navigation arrows

**State Management**: Framer Motion animations with `<AnimatePresence>`

#### Common Components (3 files in src/components/common/)

1. **AmbientBackground.tsx** - Animated orbs + grid overlay
2. **Omnibar.tsx** - Floating action bar (email, resume, book time)
3. **SEO.tsx** - Dynamic meta tags via react-helmet-async

#### Blog Components

1. **Blog.tsx** - Blog list with auto-discovery of markdown files
2. **BlogPostModal.tsx** - Full-screen reader with:
   - Reading progress bar
   - Table of contents with scroll spy
   - Code syntax highlighting
   - Copy code buttons
   - Like system
   - Social sharing
   - Related posts

---

### 7. DESIGN SYSTEM

**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/styles/globals.css

#### CSS Custom Properties

**Colors** (Dark â†’ Light):
- Background: `#08080a` â†’ `#fafafa`
- Text Primary: `#e8e6e3` â†’ `#050505`
- Accent: `#c29a6c` â†’ `#8a6642`
- Success: `#4ade80` â†’ `#22c55e`

**Spacing Scale**:
```css
--space-xs: 4px
--space-sm: 8px
--space-md: 16px
--space-lg: 24px
--space-xl: 32px
--space-2xl: 48px
--space-3xl: 64px
--space-4xl: 80px
--space-5xl: 96px
--space-6xl: 128px
```

**Typography**:
- Serif: 'Instrument Serif' (italics for headlines)
- Sans: 'Instrument Sans' (body + UI)

**Layout**:
- Max width: `1600px` (wide, premium feel)
- Nav height: `20px` (compact)
- Drawer width: `min(960px, 95vw)`
- Drawer z-index: `200`

**Effects**:
- Transitions: `cubic-bezier(0.16, 1, 0.3, 1)`
- Glass surfaces: `backdrop-filter: blur(12px)`
- Ambient orbs: Radial gradients with animation
- Grid overlay: Dot pattern with opacity

### 8. SPECIAL FEATURES

#### A. Blog Like System
**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/src/lib/likes.ts

- Client-side only (localStorage)
- User fingerprinting (canvas + navigator)
- Like/unlike with count tracking
- Analytics dashboard component
- Export functionality for data analysis

#### B. Content Validation CLI
**File**: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/scripts/validate-content.ts

- Validates all YAML and markdown files
- Color-coded terminal output
- Exit code for CI/CD integration
- Detailed error messages with field paths

#### C. Responsive Breakpoints
```typescript
const isMobile = windowWidth < 768
const isTablet = windowWidth >= 768 && windowWidth < 1024
const isDesktop = windowWidth >= 1024
```

#### D. Accessibility Features
- Skip to content link
- ARIA labels on interactive elements
- Keyboard navigation (ESC to close modals)
- Focus indicators
- Semantic HTML structure

### 9. BUILD & DEPLOYMENT

**Build Process**:
1. TypeScript compilation: `tsc -b`
2. Vite build: `vite build`
3. Output: `/dist` directory
4. Validation: `npm run validate` (pre-commit)

**Vite Configuration** (/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/vite.config.ts):
```typescript
export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [
    react(),  // React Fast Refresh
    yaml()    // @rollup/plugin-yaml for YAML imports
  ],
  base: '/',
})
```

**Testing**:
- Vitest for unit tests
- @testing-library/react for component tests
- jsdom for DOM simulation
- 7 test files with 187+ passing tests

---

### 10. DEVELOPMENT WORKFLOW

#### Content Updates
1. Edit YAML/markdown in `/content`
2. Run `npm run validate` to check schemas
3. Vite hot-reloads automatically
4. Content appears immediately

#### Adding New Case Study
1. Copy template from `content/_templates/case-study.md`
2. Fill frontmatter fields
3. Write markdown content
4. Validate: `npm run validate`
5. Auto-discovered by `import.meta.glob()`

#### Adding New Blog Post
1. Create `YYYY-MM-DD-slug.md` in `content/blog/`
2. Add frontmatter (title, date, excerpt, tags)
3. Write markdown content
4. Validate and auto-discovered

#### Theme Development
1. Add CSS variable to `styles/globals.css`
2. Define for both `:root` (dark) and `[data-theme="light"]`
3. Use in components: `var(--your-variable)`
4. Test theme toggle

---

---

### 12. KEY INSIGHTS

1. **Content-First Architecture**: All content lives in structured YAML/markdown, validated by Zod schemas. Components are purely presentational.

2. **Type Safety End-to-End**: Zod schemas â†’ TypeScript types â†’ Component props. No runtime surprises.

3. **CSS Variables for Theming**: Moved away from context-based colors to CSS custom properties. Instant theme switching, no re-renders.

4. **Auto-Discovery Pattern**: `import.meta.glob()` automatically discovers case studies and blog posts. No manual registration needed.

5. **Validation-First Workflow**: `npm run validate` catches errors before they reach production. CLI blocks bad commits.

6. **Modular Component Design**: Large components (CaseStudyModal) refactored into smaller, focused sub-components.

7. **Premium Design System**: Instrument Serif + Sans fonts, glassmorphism, ambient orbs, smooth animations via Framer Motion.

8. **Accessibility Built-In**: Skip links, ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, semantic HTML throughout.

9. **Blog as First-Class Feature**: Full reading experience with progress tracking, TOC, code highlighting, likes, and social sharing.

10. **AI-Friendly Documentation**: Comprehensive `/context` directory with architecture, design system, and governance rules for AI agents.

---

This portfolio represents a sophisticated, production-ready React application with a clean separation between content, business logic, and presentation. The architecture prioritizes developer experience, type safety, and maintainability while delivering a premium user experience.

     8â†’
     9â†’import { z } from 'zod';
    10â†’import YAML from 'yaml';
    11â†’import type { PortfolioContent, CaseStudy } from '../types/portfolio';
    12â†’import {
    13â†’  ProfileSchema,
    14â†’  ExperienceSchema,

    23â†’

    28â†’import certificationsYaml from '../../content/certifications/index.yaml';
    29â†’import skillsYaml from '../../content/skills/index.yaml';
    30â†’import socialYaml from '../../content/social/index.yaml';
    31â†’import passionProjectsYaml from '../../content/passion-projects/index.yaml';
    32â†’
    33â†’// Auto-discover case studies using import.meta.glob (now markdown files)
    34â†’const caseStudyFiles = import.meta.glob('../../content/case-studies/*.md', { query: '?raw', eager: true });
    35â†’
    36â†’// Re-export schemas for backward compatibility
    37â†’export {
    38â†’  ProfileSchema,
    39â†’  ExperienceSchema,
    40â†’  TestimonialsSchema,
    41â†’  CertificationsSchema,
    42â†’  SkillsSchema,
    43â†’  SocialSchema,
    44â†’  CaseStudySchema,
    45â†’  PassionProjectsSchema,
    46â†’  BlogPostSchema
    47â†’};
    48â†’
    49â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    50â†’// Frontmatter Parsing
    51â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    52â†’
    53â†’function parseFrontmatter(raw: string): { frontmatter: Record<string, unknown>; content: string } {
    54â†’  const match = raw.match(/^---\n([\s\S]*?)\n---\n([\s\S]*)$/);
    55â†’  if (!match) return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    56â†’
    57â†’  const frontmatterStr = match[1];
    58â†’  const content = match[2].trim();
    59â†’
    60â†’  try {
    61â†’    const frontmatter = YAML.parse(frontmatterStr);
    62â†’    return { frontmatter, content };
    63â†’  } catch (error) {
    64â†’    console.error('Failed to parse frontmatter:', error);
    65â†’    return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    66â†’  }
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    70â†’// Runtime Validation
    71â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    72â†’
    73â†’function validate<T>(schema: z.ZodSchema<T>, data: unknown, filename: string): T {
    74â†’  try {
    75â†’    return schema.parse(data);
    76â†’  } catch (error) {
    77â†’    if (error instanceof z.ZodError) {
    78â†’      console.error(`âŒ Validation failed for ${filename}:`, error.flatten().fieldErrors);
    79â†’      throw new Error(`Invalid content in ${filename}: ${error.message}`);
    80â†’    }
    81â†’    throw error;
    82â†’  }
    83â†’}
    84â†’
    85â†’// Export validated content
    86â†’export const profile = validate(ProfileSchema, profileYaml, 'profile.yaml');
    87â†’export const experience = validate(ExperienceSchema, experienceYaml, 'experience/index.yaml');
    88â†’export const testimonials = validate(TestimonialsSchema, testimonialsYaml, 'testimonials/index.yaml');
    89â†’export const certifications = validate(CertificationsSchema, certificationsYaml, 'certifications/index.yaml');
    90â†’export const skills = validate(SkillsSchema, skillsYaml, 'skills/index.yaml');
    91â†’export const social = validate(SocialSchema, socialYaml, 'social/index.yaml');
    92â†’export const passionProjectsData = validate(PassionProjectsSchema, passionProjectsYaml, 'passion-projects/index.yaml');
    93â†’export const passionProjects = passionProjectsData.projects;
    94â†’
    95â†’// Parse and validate case studies from markdown files
    96â†’function parseCaseStudies(): CaseStudy[] {
    97â†’  return Object.entries(caseStudyFiles)
    98â†’    .map(([path, module]) => {
    99â†’      const filename = path.split('/').pop() || 'unknown';
   100â†’      const raw = (module as { default: string }).default;
   101â†’      const { frontmatter, content } = parseFrontmatter(raw);
   102â†’      
   103â†’      // Combine frontmatter with content
   104â†’      const caseStudyData = {
   105â†’        ...frontmatter,
   106â†’        content
   107â†’      };
   108â†’      
   109â†’      return validate(CaseStudySchema, caseStudyData, filename);
   110â†’    })
   111â†’    .sort((a, b) => a.id - b.id);
   112â†’}
   113â†’
   114â†’export const caseStudies = parseCaseStudies();
   115â†’
   116â†’// Aggregated content export
   117â†’export const content: PortfolioContent = {
   118â†’  profile,
   119â†’  experience,
   120â†’  testimonials,
   121â†’  certifications,
   122â†’  skills,
   123â†’  social,
   124â†’  caseStudies,
   125â†’  passionProjects,
   126â†’};
   127â†’
   128â†’// Helper functions
   129â†’export function getCaseStudyBySlug(slug: string) {
   130â†’  return caseStudies.find(cs => cs.slug === slug);
   131â†’}
   132â†’
   133â†’export function getCaseStudyById(id: number) {
   134â†’  return caseStudies.find(cs => cs.id === id);
   135â†’}
   136â†’
   137â†’export function getFeaturedTestimonials() {
   138â†’  return testimonials.testimonials.filter(t => t.featured);
   139â†’}
   140â†’
   141â†’export function getFeaturedCertifications() {
   142â†’  return certifications.certifications.filter(c => c.featured);
   143â†’}
   144â†’
   145â†’export function getPrimarySocialLinks() {

   147â†’}
   148â†’
   149â†’export function isSectionVisible(section: keyof typeof profile.sections): boolean {
   150â†’  return profile.sections[section];
   151â†’}
   152â†’
   153â†’export default content;

     1â†’# Web3 Portfolio Design System
     2â†’
     3â†’A comprehensive design system for a Web3 product manager portfolio featuring dark and light modes with elegant typography and consistent spacing.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Features
     6â†’
     7â†’- ğŸ¨ **Dual Theme Support**: Seamless dark and light mode switching
     8â†’- ğŸ”¤ **Premium Typography**: Instrument Serif & Instrument Sans font pairing
     9â†’- ğŸ“ **Consistent Spacing**: Token-based spacing system
    10â†’- ğŸ§© **Reusable Components**: Production-ready React components
    11â†’- âœ¨ **Smooth Animations**: Premium easing and transitions
    12â†’- ğŸ“± **Fully Responsive**: Mobile, tablet, and desktop optimized
    13â†’
    14â†’## ğŸš¨ Governance ("The Prime Directive")
    15â†’**The Design System is the Single Source of Truth.**
    16â†’*   **Do not** use hardcoded values in components.
    17â†’*   **Do not** add "snowflake" styles without justification.
    18â†’*   **Updates**: If you need a new style, add it to `globals.css` AND document it here first.
    19â†’
    20â†’## Quick Start
    21â†’
    22â†’### Theme System
    23â†’
    24â†’The design system uses CSS custom properties for theming. Toggle between dark and light modes using the `ThemeToggle` component.

   115â†’Small labels for categorization:
   116â†’

   119â†’```
   120â†’

   122â†’Visual status with optional label:

   126â†’```
   127â†’
   128â†’#### Section Header
   129â†’Labeled divider for sections:
   130â†’
   131â†’```tsx
   132â†’<SectionHeader label="Section Title" />
   133â†’```
   134â†’
   135â†’### Navigation
   136â†’
   137â†’Fixed navigation with "Frosted Glass" (Glassmorphism) effect and compact padding.
   138â†’
   139â†’```tsx
   140â†’<Navigation logo="yourname.eth" />
   141â†’```
   142â†’
   143â†’### Floating Actions (Omnibar)
   144â†’

   146â†’
   147â†’```tsx
   148â†’<Omnibar />
   149â†’```
   150â†’
   151â†’### Case Study Links
   152â†’

   154â†’
   155â†’```tsx

   160â†’
   161â†’#### Link Buttons
   162â†’- **Primary buttons (with labels)**: Live, Code, Docs
   163â†’- **Media buttons (icon-only)**: Blog, Twitter, LinkedIn, Video, Article, Slides
   164â†’- **Hover effect**: Border and text change to `--color-accent`
   165â†’- **Styling**: Consistent border outline style (no solid fills)

   176â†’
   177â†’## Color System
   178â†’
   179â†’### CSS Variables
   180â†’

   182â†’

   185â†’- `--color-text-primary`: #e8e6e3

   194â†’- `--color-success`: #22c55e

   197â†’#### Component-Specific Tokens (Dec 2024)

   199â†’- `--color-overlay-dark`: Semi-transparent overlay for thumbnails
   200â†’- `--color-overlay-text`: Text color on dark overlays

   314â†’- `--drawer-width`: **800px** (Case Study slide-over width)

   317â†’- `--omnibar-height`: **56px** (Standard touch target height)

   346â†’## Best Practices
   347â†’
   348â†’1. **Always use CSS variables** for colors and spacing
   349â†’2. **Use semantic component names** for clarity
   350â†’3. **Maintain consistent spacing** using the token system
   351â†’4. **Test both themes** when adding new components
   352â†’5. **Follow responsive patterns** established in the system
   353â†’6. **Use proper semantic HTML** for accessibility
   354â†’7. **Leverage the easing functions** for consistent animations
   355â†’
   356â†’## Customization
   357â†’
   358â†’### Changing Colors
   359â†’
   360â†’Edit the CSS variables in `/styles/globals.css`:
   361â†’
   362â†’```css
   363â†’:root {
   364â†’  --color-accent: #your-color;
   365â†’}
   366â†’
   367â†’[data-theme="light"] {
   368â†’  --color-accent: #your-light-color;
   369â†’}
   370â†’```
   371â†’
   372â†’### Adding New Components
   373â†’
   374â†’1. Create component in `/components`
   375â†’2. Add styles to `/components/components.css`
   376â†’3. Use existing design tokens
   377â†’4. Test in both themes
   378â†’5. Ensure responsive behavior
   379â†’
